title: Cara Delevingne parties with Ashley Benson at Nasty Gal party launch
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Cara Delevingne spent the launch of her new collaboration with Nasty Gal loved up with Ashley Benson.

The pair, who were rumoured to have wed in Las Vegas, were sported without the rings they had previously been wearing, but sources at the event revealed that ‘Cara didn’t leave Ashley’s side even though it was her night’.

‘She made sure Ashley was with her the whole time.’

Video of the pair together saw Cara dance her way to the DJ booth where Ashley was hanging out, before they enjoyed a hello kiss and then made their way to a VIP area.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘They seem totally loved up, they only have eyes for each other,’ the insider added.

Cara Delevingne arrives at the Nasty Gal Launch (Picture: Backgrid)

In July it was thought the supermodel and the Pretty Little Liars actress had become engaged after they were pictured wearing matching bands.

The A-listers were holidaying in France at the time, when they were seen looking all loved up as they showcased their new jewellery and it was then speculated that the duo had jetted off to Las Vegas where they supposedly said their vows at the Little Chapel in August.

In July it was thought the supermodel and the Pretty Little Liars actress had become engaged (Picture: Backgrid)

However, since then, it’s been said that the loved up couple are not actually legally married, and instead chose to have a ‘friendship ceremony’.

Cara has been outspoken about her sexuality and gender identity many times in the past and the importance of positive representation isn’t lost on Cara.

Cara and Ashley Benson have been dating for over a year (Picture: Backgrid)

She addressed exactly that in an interview in which she admitted that she thought it was ‘great’ if her romance was ‘raising awareness for young girls or anyone to see relationships in a way where they’re like, that’s a possibility’.

The Suicide Squad star also opened up about their relationship for the first time, admitting Ashley makes her a ‘better’ person.

Ashley makes her a ‘better’ person (Picture: Getty)

Lifting the lid on how they manage to make things work despite having very busy schedules, she said: ‘Long-distance relationships are always tough. We make it work though. We have to. And it definitely makes me a better, happier person.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I’d never truly let anyone in before, for fear of them leaving.

‘I never really trusted people, or felt worthy of it, and I always pushed them away. She’s the first person that has said: “You can’t push me away. I’m going to be nice to you, I love you.” I’m just like, “Wait, so all I have to do is just let you be nice to me? Why have I never done that before? Okay.”‘

MORE: Strictly Come Dancing Katya Jones laughs off claims she gave Catherine Tyldesley a ‘dirty look’
description: Cara Delevingne and Ashley Benson only had eyes for each other.
